name: Qatar
description: Qatar, officially the State of Qatar, is a country in the Middle East located on the Persian Gulf. It's characterized by its vast deserts, dramatic limestone plateaus, and a rapidly developing modern infrastructure. Qatar is a major global producer of liquefied natural gas and plays a significant role in regional politics and culture. The country boasts a unique blend of traditional Bedouin heritage and contemporary urban life.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Qatar's population is primarily comprised of expatriates, contributing to a diverse cultural landscape.
quickFacts.detail: The vast majority of the population resides in Doha, the capital city.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Doha is a vibrant metropolis and the economic and cultural heart of Qatar.
quickFacts.detail: It's known for its modern architecture, luxury hotels, and bustling souqs.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Qatar is a relatively small country, making it easy to explore its diverse landscapes.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 75% of the country is covered by desert.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Qatari Riyal is pegged to the US dollar.
quickFacts.detail: Credit cards are widely accepted, but it's useful to have some cash for smaller purchases.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: Arabic is the official language of Qatar.
quickFacts.detail: English is also widely spoken, particularly in business and tourism.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Qatar has one of the highest GDPs per capita in the world, largely due to its natural gas reserves.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is heavily reliant on the energy sector.

climateData.title: Qatar's Climate
climateData.description: Qatar experiences a hot and arid climate throughout the year. Summers are exceptionally hot and humid, while winters are mild and pleasant. Rainfall is scarce, primarily occurring during the winter months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: This is Qatar's hottest and most humid season. Temperatures regularly exceed 40°C (104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures begin to moderate, and humidity decreases. This is a pleasant time to visit.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winters are mild and relatively cool, with average daytime temperatures around 20°C (68°F). Rainfall is most common during this period.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Temperatures gradually increase, and the landscape comes alive with blooming desert flowers.

naturalWonders.name: Doha Corniche
naturalWonders.description: The Doha Corniche is a stunning 7km (4.3 miles) waterfront promenade that stretches along Doha Bay. It offers breathtaking views of the city skyline and the Arabian Gulf.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Corniche is a popular spot for walking, cycling, and enjoying outdoor activities. It features numerous cafes, restaurants, and public art installations.
viewingTips: Visit during sunset for spectacular views.
Take a leisurely stroll along the promenade.

naturalWonders.name: The Inland Sea (Al Wakrah)
naturalWonders.description: The Inland Sea is a stunning waterway that separates the peninsula of Qatar from the rest of the Arabian Peninsula. It's characterized by its turquoise waters, dramatic limestone cliffs, and rich marine life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Inland Sea is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular destination for boat tours, water sports, and exploring the traditional fishing villages along its shores. The Khor Al Adaa is a particularly striking feature.
viewingTips: Take a dhow cruise to explore the Inland Sea.
Visit the Pearl-Qatar development for stunning views.

naturalWonders.name: Sealine Beach
naturalWonders.description: Sealine Beach is a pristine stretch of coastline located on the west coast of Qatar, offering a unique blend of desert and sea. It's renowned for its turquoise waters, white sand beaches, and abundant marine life.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Guests can enjoy a variety of activities, including snorkeling, diving, fishing, and waterskiing. The area is also home to several luxury resorts and villas.
viewingTips: Enjoy a sunset dinner on the beach.

ecosystemData.title: Qatar's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Qatar's ecosystems are remarkably diverse, considering its arid climate. They range from coastal wetlands and coral reefs to vast sand dunes and rocky plateaus. Conservation efforts are crucial to protect these unique environments.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Qatar's coral reefs and coastal waters support a rich variety of marine life, including fish, turtles, dolphins, and seabirds.

statistics.details: Diverse coral communities thrive in sheltered bays.
A wide range of fish species inhabit the waters around Qatar.

notableSpecies.name: Hawksbill Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator of reef health.

biodiversityCategories.name: Desert Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: The vast deserts of Qatar are home to specialized plants and animals adapted to the harsh conditions.

notableSpecies.name: Arabian Gazelle
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of the desert landscape.

notableSpecies.name: Sand Fox
notableSpecies.significance: Adapted to survive in extreme heat.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Qatar
activities.description: Qatar offers a diverse range of outdoor activities, catering to all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking & Trekking
activityCategories.description: Explore Qatar's rugged landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Inland Desert Hike
activities.description: Hike through the stunning desert landscapes, experiencing the unique flora and fauna.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, sunscreen, hat, plenty of water.

activities.name: Coastal Trail Walk
activities.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the Doha Corniche or other coastal trails.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Experience the thrill of water sports in Qatar's turquoise waters.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Diving
activities.description: Discover the underwater wonders of Qatar's coral reefs.

clothing.summer: Lightweight, breathable clothing, swimwear, hat, sunglasses.
clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, sweater, jacket, scarf, gloves.

equipment.basic: Reusable water bottle, sunscreen, insect repellent.
equipment.hiking: Sturdy hiking boots, backpack, map, compass.
